title: Recitations & First Bite Supplication
description: Recommended recitations at the moment of Iftar, including Surah al-Qadr and a specific plea for forgiveness to be said with the very first bite of food.

phrases.english: To recite a chapter of the Quran at the time of breaking the fast.
O Allah, send Your blessings upon Muhammad and the family of Muhammad.

phrases.arabic: يقول حين يتناول أوّل لقمة في الإفطار:
phrases.english: One recites upon taking the first morsel when breaking the fast:
phrases.transliteration: Yaqūlu ḥīna yatanāwalu awwala luqmatin fil-ifṭār:

phrases.english: In the name of Allah, the Compassionate, the Merciful.
Imam al-Hasan (peace be upon him) said:

O Allah, be for Your representative, the Proof, son of al-Hasan—Your blessings be upon him and his forefathers—in this hour and in every hour, a Guardian, a Protector, a Leader, a Helper, a Guide, and a Watchman, until You settle him upon Your earth in willing obedience and grant him long life therein.

phrases.arabic: مَنْ قالَ ذلِك غَفَرَ اللَّهُ لَهُ»(3).
phrases.english: Whosoever recites this, Allah shall forgive him.
phrases.transliteration: Man qāla dhālika ghafara Allāhu lahu.

phrases.english: I bear witness that you established the prayer, gave the zakat, enjoined what is right, forbade what is evil, and obeyed Allah and His Messenger until the certainty (of death) came to you.

phrases.arabic: الدعاء عند الإفطار فللصائم دعوة مجابة عند الإفطار كما روي ذلك عن النبيّ صلى الله عليه و آله (4).
phrases.english: Supplication at the time of breaking the fast: Indeed, for the fasting person, there is a supplication that is answered at the time of breaking the fast, as has been narrated from the Prophet (may Allah bless him and his family).
phrases.transliteration: Ad-du‘ā’ ‘inda al-ifṭār: falil-ṣā’imi da‘watun mujābatun ‘inda al-ifṭār kamā ruwiya dhālika ‘an al-nabiyyi (ṣallā Allāhu ‘alayhi wa-ālihi) (4).
